profileText: A Representative from Kentucky; born in Fredericksburg, Spotsylvania County, Va., October 20, 1764; moved with his father to Pennsylvania, where he attended the public schools; moved to Kentucky and engaged in the surveying of lands; moved to Bullitt County, Ky., in 1788 and engaged in the manufacture of salt; member of the State house of representatives in 1795 and 1806; served in the State senate 1800-1804; elected as a Republican to the Eleventh Congress (March 4, 1809-March 3, 1811); was a Whig after the organization of that party; died near Shepherdsville, Bullitt County, Ky., August 11, 1844; interment in State Cemetery, Frankfort, Ky.

researchRecord.name: n.d., 1814; 2 items.
researchRecord.description: This group of papers contains an 1814 list of Henry Crist's taxable property, including lands in several Kentucky counties, slaves, and horses. There is also an undated biographical sketch about Henry Crist as a Bullitt County, Kentucky, settler written by a student at Glen Meadow School.
